pull.title: net: make a few values immutable, and use deterministic randomness for the localnonce
pull.body:
As briefly discussed in #8708 (which conflicts here, I'll fix one up post-merge of the other).

@sipa is siphash of a single incrementing int strong enough here for preventing fingerprinting?

events.message: net: constify a few CNode vars to indicate that they're threadsafe
net: Use deterministic randomness for CNode's nonce, and make it const

events.body: As discussed on IRC, Travis failure unrelated.

Rerun and archived failure here:

```
test count = ../../../src/secp256k1/src/tests.c64
random seed = 803fa67dcab64b4b14a4c0089a34e7b6
:393: test condition failed: ((~x[m][shift]) << (64 - (1 << usebits))) == 0
```

rename.from: net: make a few values immutible, and use deterministic randomness for the localnonce
rename.to: net: make a few values immutable, and use deterministic randomness for the localnonce

events.body: @MarcoFalke's failure is a randomness test in libsecp256k1 that has a very low (but still too high) false positive rate.

issue.title: net: have CConnman handle message sending
issue.body:
See individual commits for more description. In particular, 75ead75890b9b5ca5565a31d5fe9ad31dc9a96fa.

This (along with #8707) fixes the current maxupload test failure.

issue.title: Net cherries
issue.body:
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8715 - net: only delete CConnman if it's been created
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9289 - net: drop boost::thread_group
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8688 - Move static global randomizer seeds into CConnman
  * Removed all "KeyedNetworkGroup" changes. We use a different node eviction scheme.
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8822 - net: Consistent checksum handling
  * Minor patching, the checksum creation was moved into FinalizeHeaders on our side.
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9045 - Hash P2P messages as they are received instead of at process-time
* https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9050 - net: make a few values immutable, and use deterministic randomness for the localnonce

git doesn't recognize that net_processing.cpp is renamed to main.cpp, so all changes in net_processing are manually applied

issue.title: [Net] Massive network refactoring and speedup
issue.body:
This is a combination of multiple upstream PRs focused on optimizing the P2P networking flow after the introduction of CConnman encapsulation, and a few older PRs that were previously missed to support the later optimizations. The PRs are as follows:

- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9037 - net: Add test-before-evict discipline to addrman
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/5151 - make CMessageHeader a dumb storage class
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6589 - log bytes recv/sent per command
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8688 - Move static global randomizer seeds into CConnman
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9050 - net: make a few values immutable, and use deterministic randomness for the localnonce
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8708 - net: have CConnman handle message sending
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9128 - net: Decouple CConnman and message serialization
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8822 - net: Consistent checksum handling
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9441 - Net: Massive speedup. Net locks overhaul
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9609 - net: fix remaining net assertions
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9626 - Clean up a few CConnman cs_vNodes/CNode things
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9698 - net: fix socket close race
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9708 - Clean up all known races/platform-specific UB at the time PR was opened
  - Excluded bitcoin@512731bed0782f10092de35a960153b17ecc11eb and bitcoin@d8f2b8a8c032b83a3bd90750e58abaeece7e34e7, to be done in a separate PR
